documents.document: We love our free range life so much that we laid an egg with a heart on it. https://t.co/rIdoEQexqB
Smart, empathic and good at maths - yep, that's me: https://t.co/DQyl8EkSGP.
It's #nationalbirdday today in the USA. I'm a bird. Yay me! https://t.co/9bdec4cmWc
Yvonne found a baby bird that had fallen out of its nest. Swallowed it in one piece, with the tiny legs dangling out of her beak for a bit.
Discovered the new neighbours' bird feeder, I'm now a regular visitor over there. In return I let them take selfies with me.
@stevebiddle A sheltered spot, cool, long grass, maybe?
I wish I was allowed to go into the house and check what's under the tree for us. Sigh. https://t.co/2iwHAsqb3E
Greeted a human in the driveway today, got asked how I got there, picked up and plonked back near the run. Don't know why I try really.
Love the treats and the little foxy egg cup, but the toy is the best! Love playing ball!!! #nzsecretsanta Thank you… https://t.co/HpSx1TtQW0
My #nzsecretsanta presents are amazing! There were even chocolates for the humans (not pictured due to sun) & a don… https://t.co/wHSGCPh47L
Just went for a wander down the street - just walked up the driveway now only to see that I missed our #nzsecretsanta gift opening ceremony!
So relieved to see my #nzsecretsanta giftee loves her present! I still have to wait until the whole whānau can unwrap together tomorrow.
Exactly! https://t.co/dtuxuKKKcR
That's how angry I was about being told off for escaping from the run and hanging out in the veggie beds. https://t.co/dD9vSkMKYP
Escaped from the run super early today to wait for the #nzsecretsanta sleigh. Then I remembered that I'll have to wait until Tue to unwrap.
This time we really nailed that whole game of hiding our eggs. The humans have no idea where we lay and are now out of eggs. #freerange
Just learnt that everyone in this family has to be present for #nzsecretsanta gift unwrapping. First opportunity: Tuesday. Can't wait!
Another good reason not to eat my sisters. https://t.co/dsXe02DVSR
Donkeys on the paddock next door! We got quite upset and alerted the humans as loud as we could. https://t.co/fakZEUaMIj
Oh-oh, the human found Birgit's secret nest. 17 eggs, 2 of them broken. #busted https://t.co/1UusLzBY6d
My #nzsecretsanta gift is at the storehouse! I'm so excited! And the present for my giftee has also been received.… https://t.co/aAo2jhha6R
Was just accused of escaping. picked up and carried back to the run. When the other two were seen out too, popped back down with an apology.
It's coffee time! https://t.co/i0PixxwPct
@nzsecretsanta #Q9 #nzsecretsanta Same answer as Q1 (I think?): I've n ver watched a movie.
@nzsecretsanta #Q10 #nzsecretsanta Parrot food, a couple of hens for a family in need (by Oxfam), a Christmas tree, a heroine egg cup.
@nzsecretsanta #Q8 #nzsecretsanta I love Karori and would never want to leave.
@nzsecretsanta #Q7 All my #nzsecretsanta memories are the best.
@kiwibookgirl I do!!! And mealworms! :-)
@nzsecretsanta #Q6 #nzsecretsanta I'd lay better eggs. Lately I've been laying a few without shell.
@nzsecretsanta #Q5 #nzsecretsanta Anything animal welfare. My previous companions Sonja and Eva were rescued by HuHa.
@nzsecretsanta That last one was for #Q4 #nzsecretsanta
@nzsecretsanta Elegant, tidy, clean. I preen several times a day.
@nzsecretsanta #Q3 #nzsecretsanta I wanted to continue laying awesome eggs, but as I'm getting older the quality varies.
@nzsecretsanta #Q2 #nzsecretsanta I'd buy a larger house for me and the kids (Yvonne & Birgit) and eat only mealworms and buttermilk.
@nzsecretsanta #Q1 #nzsecretsanta I've never watched TV. We don't have power in our coop and the human's house is off limits.
Foot is looking much better now. If I was allowed to cross the road I'd go shopping for my #nzsecretsanta myself. Will send human instead.
Whoah, last night's storm blew our water bucket and feeder over! #hungry #thirsty
A small piece of wood got stuck in my wound. The female human got it out with tweezers, while the male human almost fainted.
Good news! It's not bumblefoot! It was 'just' an abscess, now we only need to keep the hole clean and hope it close… https://t.co/hPoWBGa0kM
While the human was hugging me after the dog incident, she checked my feet. She suspects I have bumblefoot. Have to see the vet today. :(
Just got chased by a dog! A small one, but it was still scary. Lots of humans ran outside when they heard me getting upset.
I may or may not be guilty of some of these too... https://t.co/wH6ExpksUD
The human said my feet were too dirty (after scratching in the mud) to come inside and sign up for #nzsecretsanta. I hope she did it for me.
@litchfieldhens this seems like a very good idea! Wonder if we'd get treats to go if we try this?
Nothing like a damp start to the day. Lots of wriggling things above ground just waiting to say hello... ... to our stomachs!
Fireworks night (week) isn't our favourite time of year. Loud explosions and high pitched whizzing noises can be scary. #animalsafety
@W_Rigs Give it to your chooks, give it to your chooks!!! It looks so much fun, they'll love it!
I want a xylophone!!! Look what other talented chooks can do: https://t.co/pmKGfVLYWe
@RoseTheChicken Yep. I had ALL the silverbeet! :-)
I get that tomato plants have to be kept safe from nasty bugs and caterpillars - but does that have to mean 'chicke… https://t.co/awehRGZspO
@gail_nz Will do! They're rather proud of their beautiful eggs. My eggs are much bigger though (sorry, just had to point that out).
The lettuce has been chicken proofed - that's a disaster! https://t.co/K7N9KKDexy
Yesss!!! It's a gardening day and I can help with the compost! https://t.co/Ru4tidt8bl
Busted. They found me in the veggie patch. https://t.co/Okt0NrSN0L
We're really enjoying this nicer weather! https://t.co/Q0J6fcQ5yI
Hanging out on the deck, watching what's going on inside. https://t.co/pFu5n1bBQS
Rain. Hiding under the flower cart. https://t.co/q2UsUwF41L
Free chicken in New York: https://t.co/O2cIlExuu9
https://t.co/Ut5Uv9ucEd This is so weird... a yodelling Japanese guy is making fun of hens!
Proving that we're tree birds. That's Yvonne in the front, me in the back. https://t.co/SuTPUmBgvL
We have a cool new door opener! Works automatically based on day light. No more hedgehog intruders! #fancychickens https://t.co/Pw2RBqqtKu
I'll be in the Chicken-Wing for the day because I'm moulting, it's cold and raining. Need to stay warm. https://t.co/kUqoXceK2g
How to make a chicken wrap: https://t.co/sDxzXtAEZA
We have a new water bucket. Not convinced yet. https://t.co/XP2ODXbSHk
We're not impressed with the weather. https://t.co/dzd2yuNAG9
Creating a chicken habitat - sounds a bit like my home: https://t.co/FYNKlDLDSI.
I'm so glad my life doesn't look like this: https://t.co/uOmVV9Jk9x.
This thing has been installed in our run. We're not interested yet, but might be once we find a body underneath. https://t.co/Vi9GsMcusT
Escaped the run to sleep in a tunnel I built during the day. I'm too far in for the humans too reach me, hehehe. #sleepingunderthestars
Exciting chicken research: https://t.co/oIBKl29JsV - we prefer pretty humans.
Birgit is sick and has to sleep in the rumpus room tonight. Hope she gets better soon.
@karoricat That's why the water tasted fishy!!! https://t.co/MUe1gMPD0L
Today I laid the tiniest egg (eggs from the others for comparison). https://t.co/Q4dobzYja1
The beer brewing neighbour brought us some treats! #yum https://t.co/Rn2FT7Tl2R
Eating some of the yummy mealworms we got for Christmas! https://t.co/jZlIOXRG06
There's a shortcut to the veggie garden via the deck, but the cat saw me and told the humans. Got turned around. https://t.co/THcKcWRHDW
Look what @bexquilliam and @Christ_Monkey got me (and Yvonne & Birgit) for Christmas!!! #yum https://t.co/guVxyDa9QR
You're very welcome. Merry Christmas! https://t.co/weFazdOGhh
Birgit was attacked by something *inside* our run at 1am. The humans are no longer wondering why I prefer to hide in the woods at night.
Have vanished into the woods again. Why would I sleep in the coop with two others if I can have peaceful solitude?
Walked out of the forest behind the sheep paddock, where I spent the night. Not sure why the humans worried about me. #borntobewild
Now that I've got my #nzsecretsanta present I can be a bit naughty again - haven't returned to the coop, will sleep outside tonight.
@aigantighe Thank you so much, I feel like a super heroine! Love the card too, especially since we're not allowed to cross the road at all!
Finally I have an appropriate way of presenting my eggs to the humans!!! Thank you, my #nzsecretsanta @aigantighe! https://t.co/Sj8bgWE7rC
So we've worked out that if we all run in different directions, at least two of us get a longer roam. Silly humans can only grab one!
What? I thought I could open it on deliverey day! How am I supposed to wait for 2 more days, knowing it's so close! https://t.co/vcfYm16JV4
I wake up earlier than the kids. Why shouldn't I hop the fence and go for an early morning wander? I tried to keep quiet.
... Too hot to go out And too hot to play ball. So we sat in the run. We did nothing at all. #chickeninthehat
The sun only shone. It was too hot to play. So we sat in the run all that hot, sunny day...
Another reason to quit eating chicken: https://t.co/0mPyI1qRLi (apart from obvious one that we're really smart friends, not food).
Today we all agreed to behave ourselves. We came when called, even if Birgit was a few minutes behind. We all got treats too!
Me and Yvonne watched, from the run, as Birgit kept hiding under trees and bushes from @Christ_Monkey. She missed out on treats too!!!
... I hid 20mins longer than the kids, but 1 snuck out again while I was being found! We found it more entertaining than the humans though.
We invented a new game. We all go to different corners of the property, then stay still and eat, waiting to be found and returned home...
You can't beat treats eaten straight from a hand. Makes you feel personally served. Must be what eating at a restaurant is like for humans.
Whoohoo, my #nzsecretsanta present is at the storehouse! Already figured out the way to the mailbox (at the end of driveway), can't wait...!
Took years to learn how to overcome the fence. Now that we're good at it they've raised the fence to 2.40m! #unfair https://t.co/VJJaEz2rCG
@stevebiddle Neighbours' chooks sleep outside on top of their hen house. Only go inside if it's really cold!
Wings clipped, fence raised, but I'm unstoppable. Still manage to throw myself across fence. Result: we're locked in the hen house tonight.
Couldn't get back into run for bedtime. Made humans search for our hiding spots when they got home late. https://t.co/AvROKIscbJ
